title.narrative: EQUITABLE ACCESS TO EARLY LEARNING AND EDUCATION

description.narrative: Equitable and adequately funded access to early learning and education for girls and boys from early childhood to adolescence, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged, are in school and benefit from improved inclusive, gender-responsive educational policies and practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Equitable and adequately funded access to early learning and education for girls and boys from early childhood to adolescence

description.narrative: UNICEF accelerated the introduction of assistive technologies for children with disabilities by launching an interactive and accessible online platform in support of children with disabilities, by adapting for Bulgaria C-Board app and by building the capacities of 253 professionals on alternative and augmentative communication. ;The CO supported the organization of the 13th ECER AAC Conference which gather over 630 experts, incl. from UNICEF across the region. A total of 157 refugee and migrant girls and 228 boys were supported to access education and participated in life skills sessions. UNICEF provided TA for the development and update of key education policies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
